name: Ritz-Carlton Cancun

reviews.text: What a perfect place. Compared to many 5 star resorts and other ritz carltons around the world, this is one of the nicest resorts I have been to. Kind staff, fantastic restaurants (though pricey), lovely beach, ample shade, nice room upgraded to ocean view - beautiful. Would love to go back soon!
reviews.title: Nothing to complain about!

reviews.text: This hotel was really different from what we would typically pick. We tend to like non-chain type places but we were traveling with extended family and opted for compromise. That said we had a great time. It was quiet, not a lot going on in the way of activities and small enough to be manageable and comfortable and really family friendly. It was esp. great for families with young children given the “kids club” and overall highly accommodating vibe. We got a surprisingly reasonable deal by going through AMEX, so I strongly recommend that you call them to arrange your accommodations if you are a cardholder. We probably saved $600 just by doing that; our family of four ate breakfast for free everyday, we got a free night, a free upgrade & $100 toward any hotel service we wanted (we used toward the kids club which is only for kids who are potty trained.) This ended up being a much more affordable hotel choice than lower quality hotels after all of the AMEX discounts were applied. Who knew?
reviews.title: Perfect for families of young children willing to splurge for excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros for parents of young children include the sand toys you are given upon arrival and a fun kids club (extra charge) that my little ones really enjoyed. In addition to watching lots of Spanish television they ate Mexican candy, baked cookies and made piñatas with some very nice ladies. Their watching TV and eating candy was fine with me. The ladies obviously had s strategy; the kids were dying to go back the next day, which was great. The only con for parents here is that the pool doesn’t have any zero entry points, which is not ideal with little ones. I would bring floaties if you are with young swimmers. As a plus the pool is really warm & well heated so it was still usable on chilly days (we had 2 of those.) Another con is that the ocean is too rough for little ones, but great for adults. The beach was beautiful.
reviews.title: LOOK NO FURTHER FOR ROMANCE AND SPECTACULAR SERVICE!

reviews.text: As others have mentioned the rooms were nothing fancy but they are completely normal & fine and the service all around makes up for this minor issue. When you order room service it always comes in 10 minutes or less, the people working are extremely competent and professional and housekeeping was truly excellent; they came twice a day and always left us sweets, etc. We had an overall positive experience here & especially enjoyed the buffet breakfast which was delicious & featured an omlette station, fresh fruit, and some authentic Mexican food which is not always easy to come by in Cancun ☺ One other major plus, this is one of the few hotel that we have ever stayed in that had our room made up with non-feather bedding (allergies) before we arrived instead of giving it to us after we got there. We always ask a few times ahead of time but no one ever cares until we get there. This was so awesome to not have to worry about after a long day traveling with kids.
reviews.title: Way overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only constructive feedback is that there was construction happening on our floor. Fortunately, it was mostly during the day. Also, It would be nice if they replaced the coffee for the coffee maker in the room without trying to charge you for it. I found that weird given that much cheaper hotels offer complementary coffee in rooms. Although it would be fine I probably wouldn’t recommend this hotel to a couple without children or solo travelers, but it’s a solid choice for families of young children.
reviews.title: Relaxation vacation; beautiful views

reviews.text: We checked in the week before Thanksgiving. Based on prior reviews and recommendations, we paid extra to stay on the club level. We did this because you get free wifi for up to three devices for your stay. That alone amounts to $60 per day for three if you need to be connected, which we all did. The club level also includes full breakfast and lunch, drinks throughout the day, heavy hors d'oeuvres for dinner and chocolates and drinks thereafter. SInce any meal on the property is around at least $20 per person, this also saved a bunch. You will not ant all your meals there, except maybe breakfast, because the options are limited, but it still saves you a lot.
reviews.title: Great food and service, but aging facilities and excessive extra charges hurt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But that did not stop the surprise charges. Despite having booked and pre-paid for our full trip for three, there was a $75 per day surcharge for our 12 year old to stay with us (with taxes, this was about $100 per day. There was no explanation for why this as not included in the packages.
reviews.title: "A dream vacation"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we wanted to use the tennis courts, I expected a charge for using rackets, but a $30/hour charge for using one of the courts, which were empty virtually the whole time we were there? Really?
reviews.title: The best service ever...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The facilities themselves are starting to show their age compared to other newer, and cheaper facilities. The hallway carpets need replacing. The rooms and their furniture are also aging.
reviews.title: remarkable service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good news is that the food and service are top notch. They make an affirmative effort to know your name, including our son. They also made great recommendations for other attractions. Like all Ritz places, the service and setting are a bit formal, but always helpful, and never condescending.
reviews.title: Highest service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a great hotel a great Ritz. We stayed Easter last year in a corner suite which had a great view of the sea the only down side was that we did really use it as was not in the room much. I think it makes a difference having the club lounge included you really don’t even need to go out and eat. We have been to other countries with club lounges but here they are fantastic here. I am a vegetarian and they were happy to make food especially for me nothing was too much trouble also they have liqueurs and deserts after they clear the canapés in the evening which is good. We are going back again this year.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: As for Cancun I had never been before as I am not the kind of person that likes mass tourism and cheap all inclusive deals. The Ritz is the most expensive hotels on the island but you pay for what you get in my opinion luxury with a capital L. Beautiful beaches great staff it was a typical Ritz experience. The only negative was that when we first arrived there were too many kids in the club lounge which caused trouble when trying to find a seat but the staff found seats for my husband and I. Also you have to pay $10 for an umbrella on the beach which I fell when you pay these kind of prices for a room they should really be included.
reviews.title: Living the good life in Cancun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all though GREAT : )
reviews.title: Five Stars for sure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They may have compitition this year as also going to Ritz Cayman
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Spectacular Service

reviews.text: I had always heard the Ritz was one of the world's top hotels so we decided to give it a try during August and we were not disappointed. The hotel and grounds are immaculate. and the views absolutely haunting. I can not say enough about the white sandy beaches and the relentless sun (bring sunscreen). The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. There are several restaurants on the property (pricey, but worth it) or you may step outside for more affordable fare. There are two large shopping malls within walking distance. If you are visiting Cancun and can afford the rates, this hotel is a must!
reviews.title: Ritz Carlton Cancun: Great Hotel, Bad Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful 4 days we spent at the Ritz in Cancun. The hotel was incredible with a very attentive and friendly staff! The pool area was great, not over crowded and the service was fast! We stayed on the club level and I highly recommend it! Great service, food and all around nice atmosphere. This was our first time at this property and would love to go back again. My husband and I travelled without our children and this was the perfect destination to do it! Not one complaint about our stay!
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arguably one the best dining resorts in North America. This was our second visit to the property, and in both cases the dining experience was outstanding. There are 3 places to eat dinner, 2 for lunch and 1 breakfast option.
reviews.title: Bon Appetit

reviews.text: For dinner, we suggest Fantino for gourmet dining and Casitas for more casual on the beach dinining. Fantino is an amazing culinary adventure- one of the top places we have eaten at. There is a bread cart they roll around, with 6 homemade breads. Their signature parmesean cheese soup is worth every sip. Nice dessert cart. They were very attentive to our needs, and although very formal, it was elegant and non-stuffy. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Beyond Excellent Hotel & Service BUT beware of the horribly uncomfortable beds and prearrange taxi service from airport

reviews.text: Casitas is very romantic outdoor dining, with dining under the stars and on the beach in a private cabana for an extra charge. The fish tacos appetizer is to die for. The pastry like taco shells are one of a kind.
reviews.title: elegant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service at the pool is prompt and helpful. Good drink menu.
reviews.title: Meh

reviews.text: had 12 nights at this brilliant classic ritz style hotel. the service is amazing with every member of staff remembering all our name, which is a great touch. although we went in low season and the club grille was closed the other resturant fantinos, if not a little stuffy, is still fantastico food. the cultinary class dinner is a rare if not once in a lifetime opportunity not to miss.
reviews.title: pure class ritz-carlton

reviews.text: the pool area is nicely laid out with the fitness centre and salon all brilliantly located. breakfast was a buffet style but also cooked to request as you would expect from a ritz. we had an oceanview suite and it was gorgeous and spacious. will return im sure one day!
reviews.title: Excellent 5 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This great hotel is able to accommodate business travellers and families with young children alike. The kids club was probably the smallest room that I have seen but our 8 year old son absolutely loved his time there, arts and crafts, cookie-making in the hotel kitchen, pool games......Amazing tentative staff through out the hotel. The pool side resturant / bar was reasonable value and great food. Will definitely return.
reviews.title: Ritz... Lived up to it's name

reviews.text: Everything clean, everything beautiful, top notch service!
reviews.title: excellent hotel, disappointing surf...

reviews.text: No shady business here, all items are priced and there is no upselling.
reviews.title: Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights in February. Used my Marriott Reward points to pay for the stay but after reading all the good reviews about the Club Level I emailed the hotel to see about paying to upgrade to the Club Level. Boy - am I glad I did. It was AMAZING and well worth the $200 bucks extra a night. I think we drank at least that much LOL.
reviews.title: Amazing Club Level, Excellent Service, Fantastic Beach

reviews.text: ARRIVAL: I booked with the hotel round trip transportation after reading a bunch of the reviews. We landed at 11:30am but didn't get out of customs/baggage until 1. It was INSANE how many planes arrived at the same time. Got our luggage and headed outside - I was worried that being over an hour late they might have left but right where they said they would be a young woman was standing there with a Ritz Carlton sign and my name on it. The concierge had actually emailed a picture of where they normally stand... very helpful. They asked if we wanted a beer/drink and drove away in a nice big luxury SUV.
reviews.title: A blessing after rosewood mayakoba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: HOTEL ARRIVAL: Upon arrival to the hotel we were greeted by Ruben. He showed us around a little bit and then took us up to the Club Level on the 8th floor. Here they sat us down with a nice glass of Champagne and checked us in. Best hotel check-in ever. We were explained that there would be 5 food presentations each day in the lounge, dress code, free internet passcode (not sure if this is because I was Marriott Platinum or you get it with the Club Level) and asked if we needed any dinning reservations. We decided on having dinner on the beach.
reviews.title: Incredibly friendly, nice beach, clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOM: We were taken to our room by Ruben (who is really fantastic BTW)... It was fantastic. The oceanview from the 8th floor was out of this world. After reading a lot of the reviews I was thinking it was going to be very outdated... but I didn't find it that old at all. Was it a re-modeled Full Service JW Marriott - no. But I thought it was still very nice. The bathroom product was all Bvlgari. Bed was very good - not quite as good as a Marriott Full Service/JW but still very good. Turn down service at night was excellent.
reviews.title: Incredibly friendly, nice beach, clean hotel

reviews.text: BEACH/POOL: The pool is huge. There are 2 connected together and then another a little further away. We only used the large one. It was very warm - honestly the cleanest water in a pool I have ever seen. There was not one spec of dirt in it. Beach was excellent as was the water. The 3rd day the winds were quite high so laying out on the beach was not great (sand blasted)... the lifeguards are always on the watch. Felt very safe.
reviews.title: Great hotel, Good beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just completed a 4 night stay at this property. I've been here before many years ago and the hotel is as good now as it was back in the late 1990's when I last stayed here.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, property and amazing customer service...

reviews.text: My wife surprised me with a birthday escape here and it was really wonderful. We booked an oceanfront suite and it was HUGE. It had a full living room, a really spacious bedroom with desk and a huge bathroom. There was also a guest bathroom near the entrance and near the living room. And the entire room had a balcony overlooking the gorgeous ocean.
reviews.title: A classic with surprises

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They do an amazing job at this property and the staff is all wonderful. We utilized the concierge several times for reservations and the maids did a great job cleaning every day and great for the turn down service.
reviews.title: Club Level Is Worth IT!!!!

reviews.text: We ate several meals in the hotel and it was all excellent. We had the breakfast buffet daily downstairs and it was great!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, Great staff and nice beach

reviews.text: The service is also great by the pool/beach. We sat out by the beach daily and they will set up chairs and an umbrella for you. And they also constantly come by for drinks/food orders.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay at Ritz Carlton in Cancun

reviews.text: I spent a week in this beautiful hotel attending a conference. Everything in this hotel is tops. The comfort of the rooms, the stunning views, the friendly staff, the food, the conference facilities, the entertainment, the beach and the pool, etc. It's located on the main strip and close to many restaurants, bars and shopping stores. You may take a taxi if you want to go to the other end. Or, catch the bus in-front of the hotel. Public transportation is readily available. Buses are modern, clean, safe, and fun to ride on them. The beach is clean with very fine white sand that feels like talc. The ocean is inviting and there are many aquatic related activities worth pursuing.
reviews.title: Luxury stay

reviews.text: I was there for the Cancun Travel Mart and was really disapointed, my expectations very high due to the reputation of this chain but the rooms are not anything special, Internet in the rooms is pricy, impossible to drink Coke since the owner of the property aparently is the owner of Pepsi distribution in Mexico....the service is good but nothing out of extraordinary. I would go some place else in Cancun if I am willing to pay for a Luxury Resort.
reviews.title: Not a Ritz Carlton
rip-off
reviews.text: Currently staying at the Ritz here in Cancun. I realize it is "The Ritz", but really, $20 per day per device for internet access? This alone would add $40/day to our tab for the two of us, or $520 to our planned 13 day stay. Rather than allowing ourselves to be victimized by these thugs we have accepted the inconvenience of having to walk several blocks where free internet service is available, and apparently still profitable to the provider. What a way to treat one's "guests"! Then there's the matter of $15 for a pot of coffee in the morning. No continental breakfast...that's just for the coffee! And the food in the hotel's restaurants? Count on 3 times the cost of outside restaurants of comparable quality. Again, I do realize it is "The Ritz", but I am captive here since I am attending a professional function being conducted at this particular facility, and resent being totally gouged for services that are clearly unwarranted and excessive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went to the Ritz Carlton, Cancun for my honeymoon, it was fantastic! The room was nice it had a private balcony. Ask for a room with a private balcony, which are only in the corner rooms as the others are very open. I highly reccomend dinner one night in the Casitas, wonderful experience, so relaxing and the food was great. We loved how they had a double chaise lounge outside each Casita for you to relax in between courses. The water at the beach was so beautiful, there were plenty of places to sit by the pool, we went in May. I would highly reccomend this hotel. I would also reccomend getting thier ground transportation to and from the airport.
reviews.title: Great, relaxing vacation!

reviews.text: We took our two granddaughters, age 10, for a week in July, and we all had a wonderful time. The hotel is elegant in most respects, though some wear in carpets, and coffee pods for the machine are included only the first morning which seemed a silly cost-saving. We had an easy time scheduling events for the kids through the concierge, and our trips to Excaret, Chichen Itza, etc., were good. Lovely white sand beaches with first-class lifeguards which is important as the surf/current can get a bit rowdy. There are two outstanding gourmet restaurants, expensive and worth every penny. The other two restaurants are very good and quite reasonable. The only downside was that it being July the pools were too warm, even hot by mid-afternoon, since they are only 4" deep. Staff were very helpful.
reviews.title: Wonderful Even in Summer

description: Considered one of the most elegant resorts in the world, The Ritz-Carlton, Cancun, reflects Mexico's rich architectural heritage in an atmosphere of magnificent sophistication. Minutes from many lively and leisurely attractions, the resort features 365 guestrooms overlooking the sea, a 1,200-foot beach, sculpted outdoor swimming pools, a full service Spa, an impressive Culinary Center and award winning restaurants.
